meanings.definition: To digest again; to undergo digestion a second time.
meanings.sent1: After eating too quickly, I felt sick and knew my body was redigesting the food.
meanings.sent2: The cow was redigesting its cud, a normal part of its digestive process.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally left my sandwich out for so long that it started redigesting itself!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was redigesting the information like a computer running a program on repeat.
meanings.sent5: The image of the snake redigesting its prey stayed with me, making me shiver.

meanings.definition: To reconsider or rethink something previously digested or understood.
meanings.sent1: I found myself redigesting the book's ending to fully grasp its meaning.
meanings.sent2: She was redigesting the feedback from her boss to improve her work performance.
meanings.sent3: The idea of redigesting math problems for fun seemed strange to her classmates.
meanings.sent4: His mind was redigesting the memories of his childhood, trying to make sense of them.
meanings.sent5: The concept was so complex that redigesting it felt like solving a puzzle in the dark.
